result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brady Jackson Lowe

defendant.name: Lowe, Brady Jackson
defendant.address: 830 N Water Street Apt 115, Sheboygan, WI 53081

records.addlTxt:
3:45 PM Defendant Brady Jackson Lowe appeared by phone.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by phone for Brady Jackson Lowe.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes this is an in-person appearance - does not hold Preliminary Hearings by phone and did not grant permission for phone appearance.
Deft states he was unaware of in person appearance.
Atty Toran requests adjournment due to identification issue.
Court waives time limits for cause.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:48 PM Defendant Brady Jackson Lowe appeared by phone.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by phone for Brady Jackson Lowe.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Toran - leave Prelim on calendar. Deft requesting the no driving condition to be removed from bond conditions.
State objects to removal, but would not be opposed to modification to allow for work only.
Court will not modify at this time, would be willing to revisit if Deft can get more information from work as far as hours, etc. but Motion is denied today.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:47 PM Defendant Brady Jackson Lowe appeared by phone.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for a public defender and is awaiting appointment. Defendant requests an adjournment and bond modification. Court will address bond at next STC.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not operate any motor vehicles while this case is pending.
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's

11:27 AM  Defendant Brady Jackson Lowe appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Brady Jackson Lowe.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Advised of Rights. Complaint received, waived reading. Prelim requested. Probable cause found in complaint.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
